SEARCH

Interface Connect4

public interface Connect4
A Game of Connect 4 and its publicly available methods. In the game, a client may access the current player, game status, the board (readonly), and may drop a token or reset the board.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    MoveResult
    dropToken(int column)
    Drop a token for the current player, if possible, at the selected column.
    Board
    getBoard()
    Get the game board.
    Player
    getCurrentPlayer()
    Get the current player available.
    GameStatus
    getGameStatus()
    Get the current game status.
    void
    reset()
    Reset the entire board from scratch.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentPlayer

      Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Get the current player available.
      Returns:
      the player whose current turn it is

    • getGameStatus

      GameStatus getGameStatus()
      Get the current game status.
      Returns:
      game status (in progress, player A or B win, or draw)

    • getBoard

      Board getBoard()
      Get the game board. See Board for available methods.
      Returns:
      game board

    • dropToken

      MoveResult dropToken(int column)
      Drop a token for the current player, if possible, at the selected column. The current player can be found with getCurrentPlayer(). If unable to make a move (ex. an invalid column was passed in), the current player remains the same. If they successfully make a move, the board, game status, and current player is updated.
      Parameters:
      column - zero-indexed, the column (by default 0-6).
      Returns:
      SUCCESS if making the move was successful, COLUMN_FULL if the column the user tried to drop a token down was already full, or INVALID_COLUMN if the column supplied was invalid.

    • reset

      void reset()
      Reset the entire board from scratch. Set the entire Board to be completely empty, for it to be the PLAYER_1 token's turn, and for the game to be started over.
